headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, Deprecation, Sunset
headers.vary: Accept, Authorization, Cookie, X-GitHub-OTP, Accept-Encoding, Accept, X-Requested-With
headers.x-github-media-type: github.squirrel-girl-preview; format=json, github.inertia-preview; format=json, github.starfox-preview; format=json, github.mockingbird-preview; param=sailor-v-preview; format=json
headers.x-oauth-scopes: admin:enterprise, admin:gpg_key, admin:org, admin:org_hook, admin:public_key, admin:repo_hook, gist, repo, user, workflow, write:discussion, write:packages

data.title: Enable DevOps Starter for Kubernetes and Functions using GH Actions
data.body:
**Summary**
The objective of DevOps Starter is to make it easy to get started from Azure Portal. It would enable azure customers to try out GitHub pipelines in a very simple and easy way.

**Features**
Kubernetes
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Kubernetes for .Net #454 
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Kubernetes for Node.js #352 
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Kubernetes for Java Jsf #501 
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Kubernetes for Java Spring #500 
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Kubernetes for Go #502 

Functions
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Function App for .Net #479
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Function App for Node.js #469
- [ ] Enable DevOps starter for Function App for  Python #461 

**EPD**
Engineering: @shailesh-sk 
Product: @ninallam 
Design: @abhishekhegde 

**Related Documents**
1. [DevOps Starter for GitHub actions Spec](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CA4ozJhFSD-GljLQ8Tj0roek0mYOoPWyRJ5Wx-Mppw4/edit#)
2. [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/Bmscgzz64lvlmcHtSgPBWV/Azure-Dev-Ops-Project-using-GH-Pipeline)

**Success Criteria**

OKR 2.2 GitHub repos deploying to Azure grows by 50%

1. No of DevOps starters using GH created per month
    Target to hit at least 500 in the first month of release.
    Baseline:The current usage of Azure DevOps is around 4K monthly.
2. No. of GitHub organizations using DevOps starter.
    Target at least 400 GH orgs in the first month.
    Baseline: On an average 3K ADO orgs monthly are using DevOps Starter.
3. No of Azure subscriptions taking deployments thru DevOps Starter
    Target is at least 350 Azure subscriptions take deployments thru DevOps Starter for GH in the first month
    Baseline: On an average 2500 Azure subscriptions take deployments thru Devops Starter for GH monthly
4. Success rate of first deployments from DevOps Starter
    Target is success rate of 100% for sample apps.
5. Re-deployments using the workflows
    Target is at least 35% of the deployments are more than once. 

Checklist:

- [ ]  Assign this issue to yourself/individual
- [ ]  Add 'Epic' label to the issue
- [ ]  Link this Epic with Initiative
